definition: Gudong desert or Antiques desert at Han dynasty Yangguan pass 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1], named after many Han dynasty archaeological discoveries

sentences.chinese: 这个周末我要买古董去。

sentences.english: Old trees are alive antiques and living national treasures.
sentences.chinese: 古树是活着的古董，是有生命的国宝。

sentences.english: In the living room they saw the table covered with antiques and other ornate objects.
sentences.chinese: 在客厅他们看见了古董和其他华丽的物什。

sentences.english: Every morning, a fresh offering of bric-a-brac from the grandfather to Cosette.
sentences.chinese: 每天清晨外祖父都送来一些古董给珂赛特。

sentences.english: Make your cyanotype prints look like antiques with tea toning.
sentences.chinese: 让你的冷色调打印喜欢看古董茶色调。

sentences.english: Proceed to Insadong Antique Street & famous fashion Street –Myungdong for shopping.
sentences.chinese: 前往明洞及古董街仁寺洞自由购物。

sentences.english: And the Antiques Roadshow has paid dividends to small dealers as well.
sentences.chinese: 和古董巡回秀已给小的经销商带来好处。

sentences.english: This antediluvian shows boundless glamour in change modelling respect.
sentences.chinese: 这个老古董在改变造型方面显示出无穷魅力。

sentences.english: Call me old-fashioned but those high-risk religions don't do it for me.
sentences.chinese: 叫我老古董吧，但是这些高危险性的宗教不适合我。

sentences.english: Among the most sought-after of these religious antiquities is the famed Ark of the Covenant.
sentences.chinese: 在这些最受人追捧的宗教古董中就有著名的约柜。

sentences.english: She said it was an antique that her grandmother got from her ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 她说这东西是古董，是她祖母的祖先传下来的。

sentences.english: Frank begged him to do so and the dealer reluctantly prised it open.
sentences.chinese: 经弗兰恳求，古董商才勉强把货箱撬开了。

sentences.english: They saw a lot of antiques in the glass-topped cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到在那个玻璃橱里有很多古董。

sentences.english: An antique steam locomotive has been displaying at Nürnberg Eisenbahn Museum.
sentences.chinese: 展示于德国纽伦堡铁路博物馆中的古董蒸汽机车。

sentences.english: He claimed he ploughed all his money into his antique business.
sentences.chinese: 他声称把所有的钱都投进了自己的古董生意。

sentences.english: Yes. It's, well,  it's famous really for its antique.
